verses.verse: So he answered and said to me: “This is the word of the LORD to (Hag. 1:1) Zerubbabel: (Is. 30:1; Hos. 1:7; Hag. 2:4, 5) ‘Not by might nor by power, but by My Spirit,’ Says the LORD of hosts.

‘Who are you, (Ps. 114:4, 6; Is. 40:4; Jer. 51:25; Nah. 1:5; Zech. 14:4, 5; (Matt. 21:21)) O great mountain? Before Zerubbabel you shall become a plain! And he shall bring forth (Ps. 118:22) the capstone (Ezra 3:10, 11, 13; Ps. 84:11) With shouts of “Grace, grace to it!” ’ ”
Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying:

“The hands of Zerubbabel (Ezra 3:8-10; 5:16; Hag. 2:18) Have laid the foundation of this temple; His hands (Ezra 6:14, 15; Zech. 6:12, 13) shall also finish it. Then (Zech. 2:9, 11; 6:15) you will know That the ((Is. 43:16); Zech. 2:8) LORD of hosts has sent Me to you.

For who has despised the day of (Neh. 4:2-4; Amos 7:2, 5; Hag. 2:3) small things? For these seven rejoice to see The plumb line in the hand of Zerubbabel. (2 Chr. 16:9; Prov. 15:3; Zech. 3:9) They are the eyes of the LORD, Which scan to and fro throughout the whole earth.”
Then I answered and said to him, “What are these (Zech. 4:3; Rev. 11:4) two olive trees—at the right of the lampstand and at its left?”
And I further answered and said to him, “What are these two olive branches that drip into the receptacles of the two gold pipes from which the golden oil drains?”
Then he answered me and said, “Do you not know what these are?” And I said, “No, my lord.”
So he said, (Rev. 11:4) “These are the two anointed ones, (Zech. 3:1-7) who stand beside the Lord of the whole earth.”
Vision of the Flying Scroll Then I turned and raised my eyes, and saw there a flying (Jer. 36:2; Ezek. 2:9; Rev. 5:1) scroll.
And he said to me, “What do you see?” So I answered, “I see a flying scroll. Its length is twenty cubits and its width ten cubits.”
